《車仔換領隊情況分析》
.
隨著安察洛提正式成為拿玻里新領隊，沙利一直與車路士無限接近，然而，其700萬鎊解約條款成為一大障礙。
消息指，車路士只願為沙利付出350萬鎊，但拿玻里卻企硬合約上指明的700萬贖身費，令談判停滯不前。
.
沙利的解約條款將於5月31日到期，須知道的是，5月31日只是解約條款到期，而不是沙利與拿玻里合約到期。意即，在5月31日後，即使車路士願意付出700萬鎊甚至更多，拿玻里也有權拒絕放人。
.
沙利與拿玻里仍然有兩年合約，年薪120萬鎊。除了車仔，另一對他有興趣的辛尼特剛宣佈任命施馬克為新領隊。因此，假如車仔拒絕支付他的贖身費，拿玻里或只有留人或另覓買家的選擇。
.
或者好多人會話車仔縮骨，俾多幾百萬鎊都唔肯，但諗深一層球會做法亦有其理由。
如果球隊要解雇干地，車仔必須向他支付900萬鎊解約金，再加上換沙利的解約金，一來一回已經1700萬鎊。
而且，當拿玻里已經任命安察洛提，車仔在沙利的贖身費壓價亦實屬合理的做法，始終車仔有權選擇市場的其他領隊，其拿玻里白支沙利薪水的情況更為尷尬。因此，現時傳聞車仔或將目標轉移至白蘭斯，又或正正是向拿玻里壓價的手段。
.
當然，車仔還大可以及時修補與干地的關係，省下換領隊的解約金、以及球隊整個體系戰術重整的成本。只是，個人始終認為干地必須離開，這點容我在今晚再詳細與大家討論。
.
無論如何，今季轉會市場提前至8月9日開鑼日前結束，加上世界盃年，球隊經過一整季動盪，必須花上時間重整。那邊廂利物浦已落實了兩宗收購，但車仔卻連領隊人選都還未落實。新領隊的季前部署、球員的融入新戰術、球隊所需要的針對性收購，全都需要時間建立。
車仔希望得到沙利，壓價是合理做法，但終究還得盡快把事情落實，相信沒有一個車迷，希望看見球會在買人上無限拖延至轉會窗死線，而現在連換領隊都一再拖延。

又出個招罷睇主場比賽囉，阿妓都係用呢招趕左雲加，今次直情要趕走油王

當然，車仔還大可以及時修補與干地的關係，省下換領隊的解約金、以及球隊整個體系戰術重整的成本。只是，個人始終認為干地必須離開，這點容我在今晚再詳細與大家討論。
.
無論如何，今季轉會市場提前至8月9日開鑼日前結束，加上世界盃年，球隊經過一整季動盪，必須花上時間重整。那邊廂利物浦已落實了兩宗收購，但車仔卻連領隊人選都還未落實。新領隊的季前部署、球員的融入新戰術、球隊所需要的針對性收購，全都需要時間建立。
車仔希望得到沙利，壓價是合理做法，但終究還得盡快把事情落實，相信沒有一個車迷，希望看見球會在買人上無限拖延至轉會窗死線，而現在連換領隊都一再拖延。

quote.msg:
《車仔換領隊情況分析》
.
隨著安察洛提正式成為拿玻里新領隊，沙利一直與車路士無限接近，然而，其700萬鎊解約條款成為一大障礙。
消息指，車路士只願為沙利付出350萬鎊，但拿玻里卻企硬合約上指明的700萬贖身費，令談判停滯不前。
.
沙利的解約條款將於5月31日到期，須知道的是，5月31日只是解約條款到期，而不是沙利與拿玻里合約到期。意即，在5月31日後，即使車路士願意付出700萬鎊甚至更多，拿玻里也有權拒絕放人。
.
沙利與拿玻里仍然有兩年合約，年薪120萬鎊。除了車仔，另一對他有興趣的辛尼特剛宣佈任命施馬克為新領隊。因此，假如車仔拒絕支付他的贖身費，拿玻里或只有留人或另覓買家的選擇。
.
或者好多人會話車仔縮骨，俾多幾百萬鎊都唔肯，但諗深一層球會做法亦有其理由。
如果球隊要解雇干地，車仔必須向他支付900萬鎊解約金，再加上換沙利的解約金，一來一回已經1700萬鎊。
而且，當拿玻里已經任命安察洛提，車仔在沙利的贖身費壓價亦實屬合理的做法，始終車仔有權選擇市場的其他領隊，其拿玻里白支沙利薪水的情況更為尷尬。因此，現時傳聞車仔或將目標轉移至白蘭斯，又或正正是向拿玻里壓價的手段。
.
當然，車仔還大可以及時修補與干地的關係，省下換領隊的解約金、以及球隊整個體系戰術重整的成本。只是，個人始終認為干地必須離開，這點容我在今晚再詳細與大家討論。
.
無論如何，今季轉會市場提前至8月9日開鑼日前結束，加上世界盃年，球隊經過一整季動盪，必須花上時間重整。那邊廂利物浦已落實了兩宗收購，但車仔卻連領隊人選都還未落實。新領隊的季前部署、球員的融入新戰術、球隊所需要的針對性收購，全都需要時間建立。
車仔希望得到沙利，壓價是合理做法，但終究還得盡快把事情落實，相信沒有一個車迷，希望看見球會在買人上無限拖延至轉會窗死線，而現在連換領隊都一再拖延。

無論如何，今季轉會市場提前至8月9日開鑼日前結束，加上世界盃年，球隊經過一整季動盪，必須花上時間重整。那邊廂利物浦已落實了兩宗收購，但車仔卻連領隊人選都還未落實。新領隊的季前部署、球員的融入新戰術、球隊所需要的針對性收購，全都需要時間建立。
車仔希望得到沙利，壓價是合理做法，但終究還得盡快把事情落實，相信沒有一個車迷，希望看見球會在買人上無限拖延至轉會窗死線，而現在連換領隊都一再拖延。

《車仔換領隊情況分析》
.
隨著安察洛提正式成為拿玻里新領隊，沙利一直與車路士無限接近，然而，其700萬鎊解約條款成為一大障礙。
消息指，車路士只願為沙利付出350萬鎊，但拿玻里卻企硬合約上指明的700萬贖身費，令談判停滯不前。
.
沙利的解約條款將於5月31日到期，須知道的是，5月31日只是解約條款到期，而不是沙利與拿玻里合約到期。意即，在5月31日後，即使車路士願意付出700萬鎊甚至更多，拿玻里也有權拒絕放人。
.
沙利與拿玻里仍然有兩年合約，年薪120萬鎊。除了車仔，另一對他有興趣的辛尼特剛宣佈任命施馬克為新領隊。因此，假如車仔拒絕支付他的贖身費，拿玻里或只有留人或另覓買家的選擇。
.
或者好多人會話車仔縮骨，俾多幾百萬鎊都唔肯，但諗深一層球會做法亦有其理由。
如果球隊要解雇干地，車仔必須向他支付900萬鎊解約金，再加上換沙利的解約金，一來一回已經1700萬鎊。
而且，當拿玻里已經任命安察洛提，車仔在沙利的贖身費壓價亦實屬合理的做法，始終車仔有權選擇市場的其他領隊，其拿玻里白支沙利薪水的情況更為尷尬。因此，現時傳聞車仔或將目標轉移至白蘭斯，又或正正是向拿玻里壓價的手段。
.
當然，車仔還大可以及時修補與干地的關係，省下換領隊的解約金、以及球隊整個體系戰術重整的成本。只是，個人始終認為干地必須離開，這點容我在今晚再詳細與大家討論。
.

車仔希望得到沙利，壓價是合理做法，但終究還得盡快把事情落實，相信沒有一個車迷，希望看見球會在買人上無限拖延至轉會窗死線，而現在連換領隊都一再拖延。

Roman Abramovich, the owner of Chelsea football club, who has faced difficulties obtaining a new UK visa, will not be allowed to work in Britain if he travels here on his new Israeli passport, Downing Street has said.



It emerged on Monday that the formerly Russian-based billionaire, a regular presence in Britain since he bought Chelsea in 2003, had been granted Israeli citizenship and was moving to Tel Aviv.

Abramovich, who had reportedly faced delays in renewing his UK visa, will be allowed to visit the UK visa-free for up to six months at a time with his Israeli passport, but cannot work in the country, Theresa May’s spokesman said.

While stressing he could not comment on individual cases, the spokesman outlined the general situation, saying: “Those with Israeli passports are non-visa nationals, which means they do not need a visa to come to the UK as a visitor for a maximum period of six months.”


Guardian Today: the headlines, the analysis, the debate - sent direct to you
Read more
He added: “Israelis are required to obtain a visa if they want to live, work or study in the UK.”

The spokesman said it was up to immigration authorities to monitor how these conditions were adhered to, and the Home Office would have more details on what could constitute work in such instances. The Home Office was contacted for details.

Israel’s interior ministry confirmed the offer of citizenship on Monday. “Roman Abramovich arrived at the Israeli embassy in Moscow like any other person,” an Israeli government spokesperson said. “He filed a request to receive an immigration permit, his documents were checked according to the law of return, and he was indeed found eligible.”

Israel grants citizenship to any Jewish person wishing to move there, and a passport can be issued immediately. Abramovich, who is Jewish and has been a regular visitor to Israel, has donated millions to Israeli research and development projects and invested in local firms.

Abramovich has not commented on recent developments. However, it is believed he could have been asked to explain the source of his wealth before he could be granted a new UK visa.

Chelsea can still sign world's best players without Champions League, insists Cesar Azpilicueta

Cesar Azpilicueta is confident the world’s best players will still want to join Chelsea, even though they will not be playing Champions League football next season.

The club’s victory over Manchester United in the FA Cup Final earlier this month meant they were the only English club other than Manchester City to win a major trophy this term.

It also meant they maintained their place as the most successful team in English football since Roman Abramovich took over at Stamford Bridge in 2003.

Chelsea have won 15 major competitions in as many years and Azpilicueta believes their record of success will still give them an edge in the market.

“Of course big players will still want to come to Chelsea because we win lots of silverware,” the Spain international told Standard Sport.

“I have no doubt that the club will get a squad that can compete to win for trophies. I am sure that will happen.

“If the club decides that we need to get players in, I’m sure we will get the quality we want.

“It was important to win this season with a trophy. It shows we are still winners. When the results are not there, people look for something else.”

Robert Lewandowski’s agent has held several talks with Bayern Munich, according to Sky sources in Germany.

The striker made it clear to directors Uli Hoeness and Karl-Heinz Rummenigge that Lewandowski wants to leave Bayern.

There have been no concrete offers from other clubs, but Real, PSG, Man Utd, Chelsea and Man City have all shown interest in the player.

According to his agent, Lewandowski is not after a better deal or more money – he wants a new challenge in a different country.

If Lewandowski has to stay at Bayern, he will not go on strike, but it’s been made clear that his motivation to score goals will not be there.
